result.execSummary:
The defendant Sebastian C Worthon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution for Buy Money of $200

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Complete any other counseling deemed appropriate by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 40 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sebastian C Worthon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Discharge regular

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
State by Hynek /  Def w/ Atty Brian Barton
All parties have reviewed PSI
**PSI SEALED PER CRT ORDER**
Ineligible Voting Notice filed
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 18 mos w/ conditions:  AODA & comply w/ trmt recommendations;  Complete any other counseling deemed approp by PO;  Pay $200 Buy Money;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Credit for 40 days if probation is ever revokedh
assigned PO Nicki Kramer

Def in court w/Atty Brian K. Barton.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Barton - The Agent has had difficulty getting some follow up information...
Hynek - My recommendation is to follow the PSI so without it..
Def - I have made efforts to contact her, we have had meetings
Court: It is to your advantage to have this PSI done.
Get a date about 30 days out

from Nicki Kramer   re: 2nd update regarding PSI.  Since PO's last letter, PO has rec'd one phone msg from def.  PO has attempted to call him daily but has not reached him.  Req CRT sentence def w/o a completed PSI as def is clearly not interested in participating in this process
Per EML:  cc to DA & Atty - file

from PO Nikki Kramer   re: assigned by complete PSI.  Def has failed to show up for mtg & has been significantly late for previous mtgs.  Does CRT wish to proceed w/ partially completed PSI by due date or extend due date until def can be located?
PER EML:  Postpone the PSI due date until def is located

State by Hilton /  Def w/ Atty Brian Barton
Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Amended Info previously filed
No victim in this case
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT:  Plea is FV&I made - finds def guilty
CRT orders PSI - due in 30 days
SEH:  to be set w/ EML
Barton addresses bond - req JSS testing be removed
CRT removes JSS testing requirement
PSI assigned to Nicki Kramer

9:26 am - Def in court w/Atty Brian K. Barton.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Barton - we have an agreement and would like to to do the plea now. 
Hynek - I have a hearing at 10am and need to meet with witness now.  This was not calendared as a plea. 
cont to 10 am this morning

10:31 am - No appearance by Def - Atty Brian K. Barton present.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Barton - not sure why defendant is not here.  I spoke with him last week. This case is not going to trial. 
CT:  We'll see if we can do it Wednesday morning.  I want to see if he shows up. 
State files Amended Information.

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed.
EML: note & file

ADDRESS INFO for Sebastian C Worthon
Current: 1306 S 4th St  #2, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2014)
Prior: 2030 S 22nd St, Apt 22, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States
Brian Barton
signe EML

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Sebastian C Worthon
Current: 2030 S 22nd St, Apt 22, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 06-05-2014)
Prior: 3020 S 22nd St Apt 18, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States
Jury selection on November 10, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Def in court.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court: Mr Beatty sent an email yesterday, he could not be here today
Hynek - We are asking for a continuance, analyst issue.
Def - I am going to be changing Lawyers too, if you could set it for August sometime.  I am in School too, getting my GED.
Would like to have EM modified / lifted so I can look for work.
Court: He has not had any violations
Hynek - As long as he maintains testing.
Court: Bond Modified to lift the Electronic Monitoring - Still required to test with Justice Sanctions
JS: 11-10-14
JT: 11-14-14
FPT: 10-22-14 at 9:00am
Jury selection on June 23, 2014 at 08:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sebastian C Worthon
Current: 3020 S 22nd St Apt 18, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2014)
Prior: 1112 Liberty Street #8, La Crosse, WI 54601

Def w/atty Beatty
$1000 sig bond signed w/cond: no CS w/o Rx w/random testing, residence has to be established before release & on EM, can be released for work & school & other things JS would approve, no contact w/ LIsa S or 1112 Liberty St
Order Directing Law Enforcement approved (not in file)

Beatty addresses bond, requests lower cash.
CRT: $1000.00 Cash Bond required w/same conditions
COMPAS Report filed
Allan Beatty

11:10 am Def in court, in custody.  Edward Minser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Minser:  Mr. Beatty is his attorney and I spoke with about this earlier today.   11:13 am  Atty. Beatty now present.  He was waiting in the hall outside Br. 2 not realizing Br. 4 was covering.

Offer made.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG - NG Pleas entered.

PTC:  4/25 at 2:30 pm    STC:  5/15 at 10 am    EML           Bond to continue.

P, in custody, w/Atty - complaint to atty
Prelim Hrg: 3-25-14 @ 11 (EML)

P, in custody, w/Atty - no complaint filed
Initial app:  3-18-14 @ 1:30 (EML)
$2500 cash bond reqd - no contact w/Lisa S or 1112 Liberty St, no cont sub w/o valid prescription, refer & comply w/CHJS including testing
